Hello,
Is there any way to get multiple files information in one API call. Something like `<https://api.hubapi.com/filemanager/api/v3/files/batch-read>` .I want to read information of some specific files. I have tried that endpoint but it is giving `404` error.

hello all :slightly_smiling_face: I am trying to get the emails sorted in order of creation date (desc.). For this reason I use the hubpot search endpoint (/crm/v3/objects/emails/search). However, this does not seem to be able so send me associations, in specific, the corresponding company id. Does anybody have a reasonable workaround or solution??

Hello!

I am using python to try to get all deals from the HubSpot api using certain filters. For each request I get 100 deals but an error is thrown when after 10000. Is there a way I can get around this limit?
Can you post your code?

Hi,
is it possible to add in HubDB table all the contents of a blog via API?
Well, the obvious error I think is the "POST",url, params=,json=filters
Also, next time do not share the private token.

Does anyone know if there is a way to sort `GET <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v4/objects/company/{companyId}/associations/{objectType}>` , by default it seems to be sorted by `hs_createdate` in ascending order but I’d like to be able to get them in descending order

I am wondering if there is any good way to read all associations type/labels from a portal without using all combinations of fromObject / toObject?
e.g:
GET /crm/v3/associations/{fromObjectType}/{toObjectType}/types
GET /crm/v4/associations/{fromObjectType}/{toObjectType}/labels
For a particular object right?
so for example pull all the associations and labels for contacts
and this would send back company, deal, tickets and everything else
`GET <https://api.hubapi.com/files/v3/files/search>` from <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/files/files>

Thanks for replying Carter. But i am more looking for all associations of a whole portal - i wasn't sure if there is anything I am missing that would list out all the existing associations. Your reaction tells me that my only route is to request this is not possible and I will have to stick with requesting it for all the objects individually.

Yeah so unfortunately there isn't really any good way to get all the associate types for every object pair in one api call. But you don't need to work through every pair either. You can just do by one object at a time.

~Never mind, I was under the impression that there would be a pagination type feature if the # of returned associations was greater than 100 but this doesn’t seem to be the case.~ The limit is 1000, so still wondering if descending order is possible.
May I ask what is the api call you are referring to? Lets say your example with the contacts?

So I'm talking about this api:
```<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/schemas/contacts>```
! I get you. I didnt consider that.
You sir, are a star!

        }
....
    ],```

Is there any way to change the cardinality of a custom association label (or set the cardinality upon creation?)

We want to be notify when any landing/webpage source codes are altered. Is there a way the changelog can post an alert to a designated user (or maybe via Slack with integration?)
For example, a designer updates a landing pages source code. An alert from the changelog could notify an approval user?

:rotating_light: The HubSpot Export API Allows for the Export/Reading of everyone single object type (140+) :rotating_light:

The HubSpot object API currently allows you to read certain object types `[CONTACT, COMPANY, DEAL, TICKET, PRODUCT, QUOTE, LINE_ITEM, FEEDBACK_SUBMISSION, NOTE, MEETING_EVENT, CALL, EMAIL, TASK, COMMUNICATION, ENGAGEMENT, QUOTE_TEMPLATE, TAX, DISCOUNT, FEE, COMMERCE_PAYMENT, POSTAL_MAIL, ORDER, GOAL_TARGET, CART].`  (There's a couple towards the back of this list that will give you an idea about the possible future of HubSpot) Which is a massive bummer if you need to do a portal migration or if you need to build a (non HubSpot) report on a unsupported object. Say for example you want to pull all the sequences and all the related data for sequences (open rate, clicks, etc) from HubSpot, well until this discovery you couldn't. But now you can get all this data (every object and all the data from every object) out of HubSpot using the exports api.

Example using sequences:
POST
`<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/exports/export/async>`
Body:
```{
  "exportType": "VIEW",
  "format": "XLSX",
  "exportName": "Sequences",
  "objectProperties": [
    "hs_bounce_count",
    "hs_click_count",
    "hs_completion_count",
    "hs_created_by_user_id",
    "hs_createdate",
    "hs_enrollment_count",
    "hs_error_count",
    "hs_folder_id",
    "hs_lastmodifieddate",
    "hs_meeting_booked_count",
    "hs_merged_object_ids",
    "hs_object_id",
    "hs_open_count",
    "hs_read_only",
    "hs_reply_count",
    "hs_sequence_id",
    "hs_sequence_name",
    "hs_sequence_step_executed_count",
    "hs_unenroll_count",
    "hs_unique_creation_key",
    "hs_unsubscribed_count"
    
  ],
  "objectType": "0-58",
  "associatedObjectType":"0-59",
  "language": "EN",
  "publicCrmSearchRequest": {
  }
}```
This will create an export of all the sequences in your portal and all the related data for those sequences (also the associated Sequence Enrollments (HubSpot creates an object every time you enroll a contact in a sequence), that's the 0-59). You can then use this data however you like. To pull properties for use in export requests you can use this endpoint: `<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/schemas/0-58>`  or the `<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/0-58/properties>` endpoint (although this one sometimes blocks you) (the 0-58 in this and the request above is the object type id (sequences in this case), DM me if you want a complete list (HubSpot asked me not to share this publicly))

It is possible that this ability to export system data is a bug on HubSpot’s side, but until it is patched, the HubSpot Export API remains a powerful tool. (@HubSpot if this is a bug please just DM me about the bounty)

Anyone out there ever had to work with a Learning company and use SCORM Files?
I'm looking for a solution to be able to pull relevant course information from a Scrom file and automatically import and publish that information into HubDB so we can show course information on the website?

Save's us having to manage information in 2 places.
